title: If Louis XIV saw France today, what would he think? - Quora

response.answer_text: There must have been lousy rulers in the last three centuries: the country is not much bigger than it was at the end of my reign. And look at what they acquired! Avignon? No problem. Savoy, Lorraine? All right, they strengthen our natural boundaries.But Corsica! Just brought a lot of trouble. Without Corsica and Napoleon, France would probably have kept the Spanish-Austrian Netherlands and Rhineland, which it conquered in the 1790s, and are way more interesting. And on the southern side, Catalonia, Piedmont or Lombardy would have been much better.How did you manage to lose Canada and Louisiana? You gave those Englishmen the keys to North America, and then they humbled us worldwide. Really lousy rulers… what?! my great-grandson! I’m ashamed. Why didn’t God allow me to bequeath the throne to my bastard son the duke of Maine?You say the time of colonies is past… But after losing the treasures, Canada and India, you wasted your time on a bunch of uninteresting African countries. Can you explain?You have not been up to the English challenge. But how could you miss the rise of Prussia? It could, and should, have been strangled in the cradle. Now it has humbled us in Europe, just as England and its bastard American child have humbled us worldwide.Oh yes, rulers have been quite lousy since God called me home.On the other hand, I see they have continued to support the arts, literature and science. That’s good; their artistic tastes are disputable, though. What’s this glass thing in the Louvre?What a curious French people speak! I can understand them more or less. But their words are strange, their pronunciation is mingled, and they don’t know the basics of the agreement of tenses. Canadians claim they have kept the pure French from my time. But to me they sound like Poitevin peasants — not surprising, most of their ancestors came from there — and their speech is so larded with English that I understand them even less. And they’re not better at agreement of tenses.Nobody in the churches!!! I’m horrified and ashamed. My father consecrated France to the Blessed Virgin Mary.Protestants have been ministers, even Prime Ministers! What’s the use of my lifelong struggle against heresy?Jews and Saracens, too?! I’m speechless.I see people much richer and more educated, and more empowered, than in my time. At first I was… surprised. But I have to admit, it’s better so. France is more powerful than it would be with the illiterate peasants, and the lazy and sycophantic nobles I reigned over. You say it’s precisely because the Roman Catholic and Apostolic Church has been demoted? I don’t believe you. You must be wrong.But these educated and empowered French people have managed to elect such a bunch of inept, corrupt and self-important politicos. How come? How can you claim republic is better than monarchy?Who’s that whippersnapper in the Elysée palace, behaving as though he were me? Sorry, Mr. Macron, you’re mixing apples and oranges.
